TopicTitle: Most efficient way to rendezvous with an inclined target?

Articles.Content:
I have a space station currently at a 200KM altitude with an inclination of 51.5 (just like the ISS inc.).

The best thing I could think up would be to wait until the station\'s orbit crosses right over the launch site, then launch into a 51.5 degree inclination. Does anyone know if that\'s a good way to do it?

Yes, you are correct.

*edit*

You\'ll actually want to launch on an offset heading to compensate for the rotation of Kerbin.
